intro: Bouvardia microphylla, commonly known as the dwarf bouvardia, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant produces clusters of small, trumpet-shaped blooms in shades of pink, white, and red, which bloom throughout the growing season. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and slightly hairy, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Bouvardia microphylla is often cultivated as a container plant due to its ability to thrive in well-drained soil and partial shade.
